issues.summary: Benelux Premium Pricing
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Content*

*Phase 1 (M0): Green Chef NL to HelloFresh NL Migration*

* Phase 1 focuses on the migration of approximately *6,000 active Green Chef Netherlands customers* to the HelloFresh NL Premium tier. This migration is necessary due to Green Chef's closing and is intended to give these customers a better home

*Phase 2 (M1): HelloFresh Premium Tier A/B Test*

* Phase 2 involves the launch of the Premium tier option for *active HelloFresh customers* in the Netherlands, Belgium, and Luxembourg. It would also include an A/B test to measure the impact on the business.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Documentation:*

* [https://docs.google.com/document/d/15ed_XKz9mITBJR9kPbc607YskJtQ-izQCrGkopcICGw/edit?tab=t.jwwlvys34aag#heading=h.e8pb13jctmh4|https://docs.google.com/document/d/15ed_XKz9mITBJR9kPbc607YskJtQ-izQCrGkopcICGw/edit?tab=t.jwwlvys34aag#heading=h.e8pb13jctmh4|smart-link] 
* [https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/2cd0b4e0-f8b8-4a93-8a2b-dd7560547b8d|https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/2cd0b4e0-f8b8-4a93-8a2b-dd7560547b8d]
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Hypothesis*

*Phase 1 (M0): Green Chef NL to HelloFresh NL Migration*

* The migration is driven by the need to give Green Chef Netherlands customers a *better home* because Green Chef was underperforming and is being closed down. The core hypothesis is that successfully migrating these customers to a newly created *Premium Tier* will allow HelloFresh to *retain* valuable revenue from the existing Green Chef customer base.
* This is achieved by offering the Green Chef customers a dedicated product family that maintains a price point close to what they were currently paying, thereby *avoiding price friction* during the migration and maximizing retention of the approximately 6,000 active GC customers.
* The Premium tier offering is intended to be relevant to these customers, as the regular HelloFresh product would not be premium enough compared to what they were used to at Green C

issues.summary: Fix pricing discrepancy in premium upgrade modal and confirm or cancel modal
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

The price reported in the premium upgrade modal and the confirm or cancel modal is currently different, making a confusing UX for our users. Consider the following:
2 x 3 plan

Premium Upgrade Modal:

!image-20260119-165832.png|width=301,alt="image-20260119-165832.png"!

~8 price difference

Confirm or Cancel Modal:

!image-20260119-165953.png|width=301,alt="image-20260119-165953.png"!

~-17 price difference
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Dev Notes*

I believe the differences here are due to the two modal using different apis to calculate pricing.
{panel}

links.summary: Pre-select a preference in account settings for premium plan to avoid user issues

issues.summary: Pre-select a preference in account settings for premium plan to avoid user issues
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Users are encountering issues when trying to switch to a premium plan due to an empty menu preferences dropdown. To prevent this, we need to pre-select a preference for users on a premium plan. This task involves ensuring that a default preference is selected for premium plans to avoid validation errors during API calls.

Error state:

!image-20260112-163745.png|width=1565,height=467,alt="image-20260112-163745.png"!

API error:


{noformat}{
    ‚Äúerror_code‚Äù: null,
    ‚Äúmessage‚Äù: ‚ÄúValidation Failed‚Äù,
    ‚Äúerrors‚Äù: {
        ‚Äúpreset‚Äù: [
            ‚ÄúPreset not valid\n‚Äù
        ]
    }
}{noformat}
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Dev Notes*

# We can use the /v1/profile/me endpoint to fetch the user's existing preference
# The initialization of the dropdown state (the default preset) is also a little convoluted in how this space works - specifically, the data flow is kind of like the following:
{noformat}/api/presets
  to
Redux: FETCH_PRESET_OPTIONS
  to
Redux: state.get('presetOptions')
  to
Selector: selectPresetOptions
  to
usePresets() hook
  to
MealPreferencesPanel (prop)
  to
useMealPreferencesPanel(params)
  to
presetOptions.getIn(['0', 'handle']) -> default preset selected{noformat}
The frontend passes the preset through a few different layers of transformation (starting at the Redux step above) and it's also likely that one of the transformations is applying a filter that might filter out the premium box SKUs.
# The presets are fetched from API, then dropped into the Redux store - we would have to verify if the presets exist in the Redux store in the first place.
{panel}

issues.summary: Remove New Ventures Systems Rotation from Teams Excluded in OpsGenie Payroll Automation
MIO Reteaming transition (Restructuring Tasks)
issues.description:
To successfully configure the new *MIO (Market Innovation & Optimization Squad)* team structure, we need to complete a series of tasks outlined in the provided [tracking sheet|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GBMyZWQ_MLnXT4WzT20cYmuyLwHQUmsRYeEOrlAPCGc/edit?gid=0#gid=0]. This initiative involves the merging of New Ventures Systems and the RTE Systems team into a single *MIO* entity. We will focus on updating team ownership, aligning key metrics, and ensuring a seamless transition of responsibilities and workflows.

We will follow the outlined tasks in the sheet to create individual tickets for each area, ensuring a structured and efficient transition process.

*Key tasks to be completed include:*

* Merging team processes and defining new operational workflows
* Setting up team ceremonies
* Conducting onboarding sessions
* Creating a new Confluence space
* Establishing a dedicated Slack channel and user group
* Configuring Google Groups for team email
* Setting up Azure groups
* Implementing Dora metrics tracking
* Updating HF Inspector configurations
* Managing Helm Charts and Comply files
* Defining Team Claims JSONs

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Successful consolidation of *New Ventures Systems* and RTE Systems teams under *MIO (Market Innovation & Optimization Squad)*
* All operational systems and tools are updated to reflect the new structure
* Relevant stakeholders are informed and onboarded

This epic will serve as the central reference point for tracking progress and completion of all related tasks to ensure a smooth integration of the teams.

issues.summary: [cls-dev-tools] Enhance progress tracking with checkpoint
issues.description:
We will want to enhance the CLI reporting with the following ;

h2. Features

# Automatic checkpoint creation after each customer
# Resume from interruption (Ctrl+C or crash)
# Real-time progress with:
## Progress bar
## Percentage complete
## Success/partial/failed counts
## Processing rate (customers/second)
## Elapsed time
## ETA
# Checkpoint files stored in {{reports/checkpoints/}}
# Checkpoints archived on successful completion

h2. Benefits

# Automatic recovery ‚Äî no manual intervention needed after crashes

# Better visibility ‚Äî real-time metrics show progress and ETA

# Safer resumption ‚Äî file hash verification prevents errors

# Performance insights ‚Äî identify slow migrations

# User-friendly ‚Äî clear progress updates

[Payments Token Service][draft] Add CLI to copy payments token from old customer to a new
issues.description:
Service: {{Payments Token Service}}

Requirements:

* Copy payments token from old customer to new
* Publish a payment verification event

Input: {{GQ Customer ID}}, {{GQ Customer UUIS}}, {{NL Customer ID}}, {{NL Customer UUID}}, {{NL Customer Plan ID}}, {{NL Subscription ID}}

Output: 

* Customer token is copied into a new record for the new customer, same token is also inserted into NL BOB DB.
* The payment verification event published successfully to mark plan eligible and subscription activated.
issues.parent_summary: Implement migration CLI for active GQ customers to NL

Endpoint: [_/internal/v1/checkout_|https://github.com/hellofresh/orders-processing-service/tree/master]

Method: {{POST}}

Input: Output of [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-84|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-84|smart-link]

*Example payload*

{noformat}{
  "fk_customer": 661064,
  "customer_uuid": "e820a7de-6723-488b-ad8b-41bfb0831a5a",
  "customer_email": "fuecoco.greenchef@hellofresh.com",

  "customer_last_name": "coco",
  "customer_session_id": "sess-12345-661064",
  "country": "NL",

  "fk_payment_token": 0,
  "use_remaining_discount_as_credit": false,
  "fraud_experiment": "",

  "plan_type": "",

    "first_name": "John",

    "office": "0"
  },
  "address_billing": {
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "address1": "Prismalaan West 3",
    "address1_street": "Prismalaan West",
    "address1_no": "3",

We need to run modules in {{cls-dev-tools/customer-migration}} in the following order:

# Create a new customer [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-85|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-85|smart-link] 
# Create a new customer address [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-86|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-86|smart-link] 
# Create a new subscription and plan [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-88|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-88|smart-link]

issues.summary: Investigate Endless Pause capabilities
issues.description: Until week 8, menus will be hidden and migrated customers need to be paused for X weeks. We would like to be able to pause customers for a period of time. I believe in cross selling the default {{cadence_interval}} was 16 weeks using legacy endless pause under the hood. In Xsell customers were able to manually unpause a week at any time.

comments.author: Wanderley Teixeira
comments.body: [~accountid:605351403adeca0067e91c8e] Need to understand the capabilities to pause a subscription vs skip your weekly deliveries. I believe endless pause used in cross selling is skipping weeks up to that cadence_interval

comments.author: Liman Labaran
comments.body: In my investigation of the capabilities of pausing a subscription, initially tried the endless pause with API v2 {{subscriptions/{id}/endlessPause}} where i wanted to pause the subscription automatically, but that didn‚Äôt seem to be working, the PATCH endpoint has advertised by Hellofresh AI Chat seem to have been removed from access in API V2 [docs|https://api-v2-entry.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io/api-docs#!/subscriptions]. I got {{Forbidden: requests must go through deliveries-proxy}} when i tried

comments.author: Liman Labaran
comments.body: We will go with the skip subscription PATCH API v2 endpoint, skipping each HF week that is required.

comments.author: Wanderley Teixeira
comments.body: Yes, legacy endless pause is being deprecated. If we can use the new deliveries endpoint to skip those 3 weeks then we should be good. Thanks.

issues.summary: RTE Systems - Update helm Charts & Comply Files with proper team details on applicable repos
issues.description:
Update the *Helm Charts and Comply Files* across applicable repositories to reflect the correct team details for the newly formed *Market Innovation & Optimization(MIO)* team, previously managed under the RTE Systems squad (RTE Systems).

This task involves reviewing and modifying ownership details, metadata, and configuration settings to align with the new team structure and ensure compliance with internal standards.

*Action Items:*

* Identify all relevant repositories requiring updates.
* Review and update team ownership details within Helm Charts.
* Modify Comply Files to reflect the correct MIO team information.
* Ensure consistency across all affected repositories.
* Validate changes through pull request reviews and approvals.

*Reference:*

* Utilize the provided example PRs as a guideline for making the necessary updates.
** [https://github.com/hellofresh/github-automation/blob/master/repositories/tax-service/.comply.yaml|https://github.com/hellofresh/github-automation/blob/master/repositories/tax-service/.comply.yaml]  
** [https://github.com/hellofresh/tax-service/blob/3592ccda8da5c825be6702ceea1a03fa0248228d/ahoy/tax-service/values-live.yaml#L1|https://github.com/hellofresh/tax-service/blob/3592ccda8da5c825be6702ceea1a03fa0248228d/ahoy/tax-service/values-live.yaml#L1]  

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All applicable repositories have updated Helm Charts and Comply Files.
* PRs are submitted and approved following the team's review process.
* Documentation is updated to reflect the changes where applicable.

This task is critical to maintaining accurate ownership records and ensuring a smooth transition to the new MIO team structure.

issues.summary: NVS - Update helm Charts & Comply Files with proper team details on applicable repos
issues.description:
Update the *Helm Charts and Comply Files* across applicable repositories to reflect the correct team details for the newly formed *Market Innovation & Optimization (MIO)* team, previously managed under the New Ventures Systems squad (NVS).

This task involves reviewing and modifying ownership details, metadata, and configuration settings to align with the new team structure and ensure compliance with internal standards.

*Action Items:*

* Identify all relevant repositories requiring updates.
* Review and update team ownership details within Helm Charts.
* Modify Comply Files to reflect the correct MIO team information.
* Ensure consistency across all affected repositories.
* Validate changes through pull request reviews and approvals.

*Reference:*

* Utilize the provided example PRs as a guideline for making the necessary updates.
** [https://github.com/hellofresh/github-automation/blob/master/repositories/tax-service/.comply.yaml|https://github.com/hellofresh/github-automation/blob/master/repositories/tax-service/.comply.yaml]  
** [https://github.com/hellofresh/tax-service/blob/3592ccda8da5c825be6702ceea1a03fa0248228d/ahoy/tax-service/values-live.yaml#L1|https://github.com/hellofresh/tax-service/blob/3592ccda8da5c825be6702ceea1a03fa0248228d/ahoy/tax-service/values-live.yaml#L1]  

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* All applicable repositories have updated Helm Charts and Comply Files.
* PRs are submitted and approved following the team's review process.
* Documentation is updated to reflect the changes where applicable.

This task is critical to maintaining accurate ownership records and ensuring a smooth transition to the new MIO team structure.

issues.summary: Backend services handover documentation
issues.description:
We need to document and align with all stakeholders on the handover and/or deprecation of backend services.

* Complete operational service handovers to other domains following the TRE guidelines.
* Develop a high-level  [+New Ventures: Backend services Ownership and Future plans+|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1shgXBKw6Mfz2uRnHWvSIBnlLmDxi1f71s5SZUqlJWEk/edit?tab=t.0] outlining the deprecation of all TAM backend services.
* Create TRE Handover Guides (e.g.,[+[RTE Manufacturing - Youfoodz] B2B Ownership TRE Handover Guide+|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ySmlmm15SnFye3yB1Fo_TJOuRKaMIB0Nd0uoQR1zEy0/edit?tab=t.0]) by end of 2025. Attach to this ticket and create separate tasks for each.
* *Schedule & Sync:* Finalize by Week 2‚Äì3 of 2026.
* *Kickoff:* Begin in Week 4 of 2026, with completion targeted for Q1 2026.

Backend service list:
